conclusion: The setup includes a gas container C with a movable piston B, connected to a U-shaped manometer D. The container C has a volume V_c and contains gas at pressure P_0.
When the solid is not in the container, the volume of the gas in C is V_c, and the volume of the gas in B is V_e. The total volume of the gas system is V_c + V_e.
Introduce the solid into container C. This will displace some of the gas, causing the pressure to change.
Move piston B such that the gas pressure returns to P_0. This involves adjusting the volume in chamber B to a new volume V_e'.
With the pressure back to P_0, the volume of the gas in container C remains V_c, but the volume in B changes. The total volume of the gas remains constant at V_c + V_e.
The change in volume in chamber B, from V_e to V_e', indicates the volume of the solid. This change is measured as the difference V_e - V_e'.
The volume of the measured solid is equal to the volume displaced in chamber B, which is V_e - V_e'.
The volume of the measured solid is V_e - V_e'.
